text: Though I only got Minecraft officially for the first time in 2016, this already brings back memories. Exploring my vast main world, finding new biomes and structures, barely escaping enemies with half a heart, all with peaceful music playing in the background. Love this game.

author: mescal x40x

text: I think we can all agree that Minecraft's golden ages were from 2009 to 2011ish (which was the first alpha release to about version 1.2) It was something special in those years. Nowadays it's all just mass produced mini games, YouTube videos and internet trolling. I miss the days when Minecraft was just about building and screwing around with some friends. It feels tainted now...
